==Japanese==
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{ja-kanjitab|木|屋|町}}
{{wikipedia|Kiyamachi Street}}

===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=きやまち|木屋|tr1=kiya|t1=lumber shed; lumber seller|町|tr2=machi|t2=town; district}}.

===Pronunciation===
* [[訓読み|Kun'yomi]]
* {{IPA|lang=ja|[kija̠ma̠t͡ɕi]}}

===Proper noun===
{{ja-pos|proper|きやまち}}

# a [[district]] and [[street]] in [[Kyōto]], running north and south along the Takase River
:: So named for the large number of {{m|ja|木屋|tr=kiya||[[lumber]] sellers}} who were formerly located in this area. Now known for {{m|ja|旅館|tr=ryokan||inns}} and {{m|ja|料亭|tr=ryōtei||high-end restaurants}}.

====Derived terms====
* {{l|ja|木屋町通り}}, {{l|ja|木屋町通|tr=[[きやまちどおり]], ''[[Kiyamachi Dōri]]''}}: Kiyamachi Street
